place.name: BRINGTON
place.gazetteerText: BRINGTON, or Briton, two villages and a parish in Brixworth district, Northampton. The villages are Great Brington and Little Brington; and the former stands 1 mile N of the latter, in the western vicinity of Althorp Park, 4 miles NNE of Weedon r. station, and 7 NW of Northampton, and has a post office under Northampton. The parish includes also the hamlet of Nobottle. Acres, 3,761. Real property, £6,459. Pop., 806. Houses, 176. The property is divided among a few. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Peterborough. Value, £434. Patron, Earl Spencer. The church contains some fine monuments of the Spencer family; has a fine set of open benches of the 15th century; and is good. There are Baptist and Wesleyen chapels, an endowed school, and a poors' estate £225 ayear. Archbishop Chicheley was rector. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
